decks.notes: The main concept of this combo deck is to rapidly fill the graveyard with spells using cards like Cabal Ritual, Dark Ritual, and Lotus Petal, then use cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy to put your entire library into the graveyard. By milling through your deck quickly, you can reach your win condition of having Thassa's Oracle in play to win the game instantly. This deck relies on speed and consistency to execute its game-winning combo as efficiently as possible.

Utilize fast mana and discard spells to put powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty into the graveyard quickly, then bring them back onto the battlefield with reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. Use cards like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react, combining the graveyard synergy of a reanimator strategy with the disruption of discard spells to create a potent combo deck in Legacy format.

The key concept of this Doomsday combo deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to cast Doomsday, a powerful sorcery that allows the player to stack their deck in a specific order to win the game. With the help of cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, Dark Ritual, and Lotus Petal, the player aims to set up the perfect sequence of cards to win the game with cards like Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Mardu Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption. By using cards like Voice of Victory, Orcish Bowmasters, and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck can pressure the opponent's life total while also controlling the game with Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. With a mix of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and powerful attackers like Amped Raptor, this deck is able to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The mana base, including lands like Arid Mesa and Wasteland, ensures consistency in casting spells and applying pressure.

The key concept of this Bant Control deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Leyline Binding to control the board, along with powerful card draw engines like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. Additionally, the inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value by allowing for a more flexible and resilient game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells like Daze and Force of Will to control the board while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Questing Druid to pressure the opponent. Dragon's Rage Channeler helps smooth out draws and provides additional aggression. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Lightning Bolt to close out the game quickly. With a strong mana base including Wasteland and fetch lands, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent while maintaining a fast and aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently play all of your spells in order to combo off and win the game in one explosive turn. By using cards like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual to generate mana, along with cards like Cabal Ritual, you can cast a large number of spells in rapid succession. By utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill your entire library, you can then use Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Duress and Thoughtseize to protect your combo.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, while also applying pressure with evasive threats like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower. Mishra's Bauble provides card advantage and helps fuel Delirium for Dragon's Rage Channeler. With a good balance of disruption and aggression, this deck is designed to close out games quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudposts and The One Ring to cast powerful spells and abilities, including Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storm. With cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Kozilek's Command, it aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining control with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. By utilizing powerful artifacts and combo pieces, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and establish a dominating board presence, making it a formidable force in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by manipulating lands and utilizing powerful land-based combos like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to generate massive threats. It also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Pithing Needle to hinder the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by recurring lands with Life from the Loam and searching for key lands with cards like Crop Rotation and Expedition Map. With strong land synergy and control elements, the deck seeks to dictate the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful land-based strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly set up the combo of playing Show and Tell to put a powerful creature like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield for free. The deck includes various ways to search for and play Show and Tell, as well as protection in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. With the goal of getting a huge threat into play early in the game, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a win before they can establish their own board presence.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful and efficient Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to play big threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer ahead of schedule. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Wastescape Battlemage help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Kozilek's Command provide additional removal and flexibility. The deck's mana base is optimized for casting Eldrazi creatures quickly and consistently.

The deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive plays and punish opponents with powerful abilities from the Eldrazi cards. It also utilizes efficient mana sources like Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb to quickly ramp into its bigger threats. The deck's key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, disruption, and powerful creature abilities.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo using Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to mill the library, while protecting the combo with counterspells like Force of Will. Once the library is milled, Dread Return is used to bring back Thassa's Oracle for the win. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for important artifacts like Shuko and Retrofitter Foundry. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Kaldra Compleat and Swords to Plowshares provide additional ways to win or control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and pressure the opponent with efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Dragon's Rage Channeler. By using powerful cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, as well as disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast clock. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to deal direct damage and close out games quickly. Wasteland provides additional disruption to keep the opponent off balance.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the board while disrupting the opponent's plans with efficient removal and countermagic spells. By utilizing tempo plays and efficient threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while preventing them from establishing a strong presence on the battlefield. The combination of disruption, card selection, and aggressive creatures allows the deck to outpace the opponent and dictate the pace of the game, ultimately leading to victory through a mix of control and aggression.
